abstract: The Upshot; mandated paid sick leave, long thought a pipe dream among Democrats, is gaining traction as politicians seek policies that can lift middle-class living standards; states, cities and corporations are rolling out new rules that allow workers time off to care for themselves and family, and Hillary Rodham Clinton has made issue an early campaign theme; some experts see opportunity for eventual federal policy.
lead_paragraph: As states, cities and corporations introduce measures on sick leave or family leave, even a federal policy is starting to seem less far-fetched.

headline.main: New Momentum on Paid Leave, in Business and Politics
headline.print_headline: New Momentum on Paid Leave, in Business and Politics
